body_html: I've stumbled upon this before. It's because standard pickle doesn't like lambdas, nested functions and nested classes. One workaround is using other pickles like dill or cloudpickle (and hickle if it works). Another may be hacking pickle in bad ways to support these (like converting lambdas to named global functions with random names, but it would probably break user expectations about reference identity of the passed lambdas).

body: I've stumbled upon this before. It's because standard `pickle` doesn't like lambdas, nested functions and nested classes. One workaround is using other pickles like `dill` or `cloudpickle` (and `hickle` if it works). Another may be hacking `pickle` in bad ways to support these (like converting lambdas to named global functions with random names, but it would probably break user expectations about reference identity of the passed lambdas).
